medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric abdominal pain with associated nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began early this morning at 6am, with worsening epigastric abdominal pain. The pain is constant, located in the epigastric area, and has not radiated. The patient has experienced similar episodes in the past, attributing those to his reflux. No exacerbating factors noted.
